name: whitefish
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a type of fish that lives in rivers and lakes in North America and is similar to a salmon but has pale flesh, or the flesh of these animals eaten as food: We caught a couple of good-sized whitefish up at the lake this afternoon. She made a fish stew with salmon, whitefish, and shrimp. The whitefishes were usually dried and shipped to Mexico.
More examplesFewer examplesWe ordered fillets of whitefish, pan-fried and served with a lemon sauce.The reservoir is well stocked with whitefish and perch.
